JobTitle: Staff Systems Engineer – Linux Puppet Configuration Management
JobFullDesc: Company DescriptionServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud‑based platform and solutions deliver digital workflows that create great experiences and unlock productivity for employees and the enterprise. Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.Job DescriptionThis position reports to: Director, Systems EngineeringThe Cloud Infrastructure Systems Engineering team at ServiceNow is looking for help on a green field project to modernize our server configuration management pipeline using Puppet, and integrating with the ServiceNow platform and the many services in our global cloud environment.   We’re looking for a skilled systems engineer and developer who can help craft the technology and processes needed to sustain ServiceNow’s rapid growth and pace of innovation.What you get to do in this role:Develop with Puppet, Ruby, and Python in order to build a configuration management pipeline that is safe, fast, and observable.Build orchestration workflows by leveraging features of the ServiceNow platform.Manage a large-scale hybrid cloud of bare metal and VMs.Work as part of a team that writes, reviews, and deploys everything as code.Write test plans and test automation for declarative infrastructure in multiple cloud environments.Research and implement new open-source and commercial tools, technologies and methodologies.QualificationsTo be successful in this role you have:Has experience operating Linux servers at scale in a production environment using Puppet (Open Source or Enterprise) modern best practices.Can research best practices and help maintain and promote high standards for development.Has a deep understanding of Linux servers and their components, including networking, storage, and software packaging.Can document and communicate systems architecture.Is comfortable with their ability to design, write and debug code in a team setting.  You should also have experience writing test specifications and understand the fundamentals of test automation.Has experience with a variety of open-source tools used in the operation of a production computing environment.Can figure things out – you’ll be working with a wide variety of systems technologies.
